pokemon.description: Solrock is a new species of Pokémon that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this Pokémon releases intensely bright light.

pokemon.name: Barboach
pokemon.description: Barboach's sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This Pokémon hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.

pokemon.name: Whiscash
pokemon.description: Whiscash is extremely territorial. Just one of these Pokémon will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.

pokemon.name: Corphish
pokemon.description: Corphish were originally foreign Pokémon that were imported as pets. They eventually turned up in the wild. This Pokémon is very hardy and has greatly increased its population.

pokemon.name: Crawdaunt
pokemon.description: Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this Pokémon, making them desolate places.

pokemon.name: Baltoy
pokemon.description: Baltoy moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this Pokémon living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.

pokemon.name: Claydol
pokemon.description: Claydol are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This Pokémon moves about while levitating.

pokemon.name: Lileep
pokemon.description: Lileep became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient Pokémon attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles shaped like flower petals.

pokemon.name: Cradily
pokemon.description: Cradily roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This Pokémon freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.

pokemon.name: Anorith
pokemon.description: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pokémon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.

pokemon.name: Armaldo
pokemon.description: Armaldo's tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This Pokémon's two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.

pokemon.name: Feebas
pokemon.description: Feebas's fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this Pokémon is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.

pokemon.name: Milotic
pokemon.description: Milotic is said to be the most beautiful of all the Pokémon. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.

pokemon.name: Castform
pokemon.description: Castform's appearance changes with the weather. This Pokémon gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.

pokemon.name: Kecleon
pokemon.description: Kecleon is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception—this Pokémon can't change the zigzag pattern on its belly.

pokemon.name: Shuppet
pokemon.description: Shuppet is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this Pokémon will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person's home.

pokemon.name: Banette
pokemon.description: Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This Pokémon was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.

pokemon.name: Duskull
pokemon.description: Duskull can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this Pokémon chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.

pokemon.name: Dusclops
pokemon.description: Dusclops's body is completely hollow—there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This Pokémon will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.

pokemon.name: Tropius
pokemon.description: The bunches of fruit around Tropius's neck are very popular with children. This Pokémon loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.

pokemon.name: Chimecho
pokemon.description: Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this Pokémon becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.

pokemon.name: Absol
pokemon.description: Every time Absol appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Wynaut
pokemon.description: Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this Pokémon will be slapping the ground with its tail.

pokemon.name: Snorunt
pokemon.description: Snorunt live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this Pokémon steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.

pokemon.name: Glalie
pokemon.description: Glalie has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This Pokémon has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.

pokemon.name: Spheal
pokemon.description: Spheal is much faster rolling than walking to get around. When groups of this Pokémon eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.

pokemon.name: Sealeo
pokemon.description: Sealeo has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This Pokémon occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a Spheal on its nose.

pokemon.name: Walrein
pokemon.description: Walrein's two massively developed tusks can totally shatter blocks of ice weighing 10 tons with one blow. This Pokémon's thick coat of blubber insulates it from subzero temperatures.

pokemon.name: Clamperl
pokemon.description: Clamperl's sturdy shell is not only good for protection—it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown Clamperl's shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.

pokemon.name: Huntail
pokemon.description: Huntail's presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This Pokémon's eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.

pokemon.name: Gorebyss
pokemon.description: Gorebyss lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this Pokémon's body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.

pokemon.name: Relicanth
pokemon.description: Relicanth is a Pokémon species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient Pokémon feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.

pokemon.name: Luvdisc
pokemon.description: Luvdisc live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped Pokémon earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean's waves.

pokemon.name: Bagon
pokemon.description: Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokémon hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.

pokemon.name: Shelgon
pokemon.description: Inside Shelgon's armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokémon's shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.

pokemon.name: Salamence
pokemon.description: Salamence came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this Pokémon's cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.

pokemon.name: Beldum
pokemon.description: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout Beldum's body. This Pokémon communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.

pokemon.name: Metang
pokemon.description: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this Pokémon generates strong psychokinetic power.

pokemon.name: Metagross
pokemon.description: Metagross has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This Pokémon can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.

pokemon.name: Regirock
pokemon.description: Regirock was sealed away by people long ago. If this Pokémon's body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.

pokemon.name: Regice
pokemon.description: Regice's body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can't be melted, even by fire. This Pokémon controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Registeel
pokemon.description: Registeel has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this Pokémon eats.

pokemon.name: Latias
pokemon.description: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémon ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.

pokemon.name: Latios
pokemon.description: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémon is intelligent and understands human speech.

pokemon.name: Kyogre
pokemon.description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.

pokemon.name: Groudon
pokemon.description: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

pokemon.name: Rayquaza
pokemon.description: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.

pokemon.name: Jirachi
pokemon.description: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokémon senses danger, it will fight without awakening.

pokemon.name: Deoxys
pokemon.description: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokémon's chest appears to be its brain.

pokemon.name: Turtwig
pokemon.description: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

pokemon.name: Grotle
pokemon.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

pokemon.name: Torterra
pokemon.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

pokemon.name: Chimchar
pokemon.description: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

pokemon.name: Monferno
pokemon.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

pokemon.name: Infernape
pokemon.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

pokemon.name: Piplup
pokemon.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

pokemon.name: Prinplup
pokemon.description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

pokemon.name: Empoleon
pokemon.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

pokemon.name: Starly
pokemon.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

pokemon.name: Staravia
pokemon.description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

pokemon.name: Staraptor
pokemon.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

pokemon.name: Bidoof
pokemon.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

pokemon.name: Bibarel
pokemon.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

pokemon.name: Kricketot
pokemon.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

pokemon.name: Kricketune
pokemon.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

pokemon.name: Shinx
pokemon.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

pokemon.name: Luxio
pokemon.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

pokemon.name: Luxray
pokemon.description: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

pokemon.name: Budew
pokemon.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

pokemon.name: Roserade
pokemon.description: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

pokemon.name: Cranidos
pokemon.description: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

pokemon.name: Rampardos
pokemon.description: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

pokemon.name: Shieldon
pokemon.description: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

pokemon.name: Bastiodon
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

pokemon.name: Burmy
pokemon.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

pokemon.name: Wormadam
pokemon.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

pokemon.name: Mothim
pokemon.description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

pokemon.name: Combee
pokemon.description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

pokemon.name: Vespiquen
pokemon.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

pokemon.name: Pachirisu
pokemon.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

pokemon.name: Buizel
pokemon.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

pokemon.name: Floatzel
pokemon.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

pokemon.name: Cherubi
pokemon.description: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

pokemon.name: Cherrim
pokemon.description: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

pokemon.name: Shellos
pokemon.description: When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out of it. The liquid is thought to be something like greasy sweat.

pokemon.name: Gastrodon
pokemon.description: Their shape and color change, depending on their environment and diet. There are many of them at beaches where the waves are calm.

pokemon.name: Ambipom
pokemon.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

pokemon.name: Drifloon
pokemon.description: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.

pokemon.name: Drifblim
pokemon.description: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it's thought to carry away people and Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Buneary
pokemon.description: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it's attacked by an enemy.

pokemon.name: Lopunny
pokemon.description: It's notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

pokemon.name: Mismagius
pokemon.description: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

pokemon.name: Honchkrow
pokemon.description: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

pokemon.name: Glameow
pokemon.description: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

pokemon.name: Purugly
pokemon.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

pokemon.name: Chingling
pokemon.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

pokemon.name: Stunky
pokemon.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

pokemon.name: Skuntank
pokemon.description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

pokemon.name: Bronzor
pokemon.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

pokemon.name: Bronzong
pokemon.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

pokemon.name: Bonsly
pokemon.description: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.

pokemon.name: Mime Jr.
pokemon.description: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.

pokemon.name: Happiny
pokemon.description: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can't move.

pokemon.name: Chatot
pokemon.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

pokemon.name: Spiritomb
pokemon.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

pokemon.name: Gible
pokemon.description: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you're planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

pokemon.name: Gabite
pokemon.description: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

pokemon.name: Garchomp
pokemon.description: Its fine scales don't just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

pokemon.name: Munchlax
pokemon.description: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.

pokemon.name: Riolu
pokemon.description: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn't make any noise during this time, so its enemies can't detect it.

pokemon.name: Lucario
pokemon.description: Lucario reads its opponent's feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.

pokemon.name: Hippopotas
pokemon.description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

pokemon.name: Hippowdon
pokemon.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

pokemon.name: Skorupi
pokemon.description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

pokemon.name: Drapion
pokemon.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

pokemon.name: Croagunk
pokemon.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

pokemon.name: Toxicroak
pokemon.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

pokemon.name: Carnivine
pokemon.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

pokemon.name: Finneon
pokemon.description: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

pokemon.name: Lumineon
pokemon.description: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

pokemon.name: Mantyke
pokemon.description: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.

pokemon.name: Snover
pokemon.description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

pokemon.name: Abomasnow
pokemon.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

pokemon.name: Weavile
pokemon.description: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!

pokemon.name: Magnezone
pokemon.description: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.

pokemon.name: Lickilicky
pokemon.description: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.

pokemon.name: Rhyperior
pokemon.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

pokemon.name: Tangrowth
pokemon.description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

pokemon.name: Electivire
pokemon.description: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

pokemon.name: Magmortar
pokemon.description: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

pokemon.name: Togekiss
pokemon.description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

pokemon.name: Yanmega
pokemon.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

pokemon.name: Leafeon
pokemon.description: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.

pokemon.name: Glaceon
pokemon.description: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that's around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.

pokemon.name: Gliscor
pokemon.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

pokemon.name: Mamoswine
pokemon.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

pokemon.name: Porygon-Z
pokemon.description: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.

pokemon.name: Gallade
pokemon.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

pokemon.name: Probopass
pokemon.description: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

pokemon.name: Dusknoir
pokemon.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

pokemon.name: Froslass
pokemon.description: It's said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!

pokemon.name: Rotom
pokemon.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemon.name: Uxie
pokemon.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

pokemon.name: Mesprit
pokemon.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

pokemon.name: Azelf
pokemon.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

pokemon.name: Dialga
pokemon.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

pokemon.name: Palkia
pokemon.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

pokemon.name: Heatran
pokemon.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

pokemon.name: Regigigas
pokemon.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

pokemon.name: Giratina
pokemon.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

pokemon.name: Cresselia
pokemon.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

pokemon.name: Phione
pokemon.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

pokemon.name: Manaphy
pokemon.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Darkrai
pokemon.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

pokemon.name: Shaymin
pokemon.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

pokemon.name: Arceus
pokemon.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

pokemon.name: Victini
pokemon.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

pokemon.name: Snivy
pokemon.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

pokemon.name: Servine
pokemon.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

pokemon.name: Serperior
pokemon.description: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

pokemon.name: Tepig
pokemon.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

pokemon.name: Pignite
pokemon.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

pokemon.name: Emboar
pokemon.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

pokemon.name: Oshawott
pokemon.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

pokemon.name: Dewott
pokemon.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

pokemon.name: Samurott
pokemon.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

pokemon.name: Patrat
pokemon.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

pokemon.name: Watchog
pokemon.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

pokemon.name: Lillipup
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it's intelligent, obedient to its Trainer's commands, and easy to raise.

pokemon.name: Herdier
pokemon.description: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.

pokemon.name: Stoutland
pokemon.description: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

pokemon.name: Purrloin
pokemon.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

pokemon.name: Liepard
pokemon.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

pokemon.name: Pansage
pokemon.description: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

pokemon.name: Simisage
pokemon.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

pokemon.name: Pansear
pokemon.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Simisear
pokemon.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

pokemon.name: Panpour
pokemon.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

pokemon.name: Simipour
pokemon.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

pokemon.name: Munna
pokemon.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

pokemon.name: Musharna
pokemon.description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

pokemon.name: Pidove
pokemon.description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

pokemon.name: Tranquill
pokemon.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

pokemon.name: Unfezant
pokemon.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

pokemon.name: Blitzle
pokemon.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

pokemon.name: Zebstrika
pokemon.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

pokemon.name: Roggenrola
pokemon.description: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.

pokemon.name: Boldore
pokemon.description: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They're valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.

pokemon.name: Gigalith
pokemon.description: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It's usually lurking deep beneath the surface.

pokemon.name: Woobat
pokemon.description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

pokemon.name: Swoobat
pokemon.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

pokemon.name: Drilbur
pokemon.description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

pokemon.name: Excadrill
pokemon.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

pokemon.name: Audino
pokemon.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

pokemon.name: Timburr
pokemon.description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

pokemon.name: Gurdurr
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

pokemon.name: Conkeldurr
pokemon.description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

pokemon.name: Tympole
pokemon.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

pokemon.name: Palpitoad
pokemon.description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

pokemon.name: Seismitoad
pokemon.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

pokemon.name: Throh
pokemon.description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

pokemon.name: Sawk
pokemon.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

pokemon.name: Sewaddle
pokemon.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

pokemon.name: Swadloon
pokemon.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

pokemon.name: Leavanny
pokemon.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

pokemon.name: Venipede
pokemon.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

pokemon.name: Whirlipede
pokemon.description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

pokemon.name: Scolipede
pokemon.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

pokemon.name: Cottonee
pokemon.description: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.

pokemon.name: Whimsicott
pokemon.description: Whimsicott doesn't live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.

pokemon.name: Petilil
pokemon.description: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

pokemon.name: Lilligant
pokemon.description: It's well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.

pokemon.name: Basculin
pokemon.description: When a school of Basculin appears in a lake, everything else disappears, except for Corphish and Crawdaunt. That's how violent Basculin are.

pokemon.name: Sandile
pokemon.description: Sandile's still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It's called “the cleaner of the desert."

pokemon.name: Krokorok
pokemon.description: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

pokemon.name: Krookodile
pokemon.description: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

pokemon.name: Darumaka
pokemon.description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Darmanitan
pokemon.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokemon.name: Maractus
pokemon.description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

pokemon.name: Dwebble
pokemon.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

pokemon.name: Crustle
pokemon.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

pokemon.name: Scraggy
pokemon.description: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.

pokemon.name: Scrafty
pokemon.description: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.

pokemon.name: Sigilyph
pokemon.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

pokemon.name: Yamask
pokemon.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

pokemon.name: Cofagrigus
pokemon.description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

pokemon.name: Tirtouga
pokemon.description: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.

pokemon.name: Carracosta
pokemon.description: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

pokemon.name: Archen
pokemon.description: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can't yet fly.

pokemon.name: Archeops
pokemon.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.

pokemon.name: Trubbish
pokemon.description: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.

pokemon.name: Garbodor
pokemon.description: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.

pokemon.name: Zorua
pokemon.description: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

pokemon.name: Zoroark
pokemon.description: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

pokemon.name: Minccino
pokemon.description: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.

pokemon.name: Cinccino
pokemon.description: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.

pokemon.name: Gothita
pokemon.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

pokemon.name: Gothorita
pokemon.description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

pokemon.name: Gothitelle
pokemon.description: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

pokemon.name: Solosis
pokemon.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

pokemon.name: Duosion
pokemon.description: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

pokemon.name: Reuniclus
pokemon.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

pokemon.name: Ducklett
pokemon.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

pokemon.name: Swanna
pokemon.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

pokemon.name: Vanillite
pokemon.description: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.

pokemon.name: Vanillish
pokemon.description: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It's incredibly popular in very hot regions.

pokemon.name: Vanilluxe
pokemon.description: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day's light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.

pokemon.name: Deerling
pokemon.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

pokemon.name: Sawsbuck
pokemon.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

pokemon.name: Emolga
pokemon.description: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

pokemon.name: Karrablast
pokemon.description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

pokemon.name: Escavalier
pokemon.description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

pokemon.name: Foongus
pokemon.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

pokemon.name: Amoonguss
pokemon.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

pokemon.name: Frillish
pokemon.description: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

pokemon.name: Jellicent
pokemon.description: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It's rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

pokemon.name: Alomomola
pokemon.description: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

pokemon.name: Joltik
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

pokemon.name: Galvantula
pokemon.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

pokemon.name: Ferroseed
pokemon.description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

pokemon.name: Ferrothorn
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

pokemon.name: Klink
pokemon.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

pokemon.name: Klang
pokemon.description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

pokemon.name: Klinklang
pokemon.description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

pokemon.name: Tynamo
pokemon.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

pokemon.name: Eelektrik
pokemon.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

pokemon.name: Eelektross
pokemon.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

pokemon.name: Elgyem
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It's said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.

pokemon.name: Beheeyem
pokemon.description: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.

pokemon.name: Litwick
pokemon.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

pokemon.name: Lampent
pokemon.description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

pokemon.name: Chandelure
pokemon.description: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

pokemon.name: Axew
pokemon.description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

pokemon.name: Fraxure
pokemon.description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

pokemon.name: Haxorus
pokemon.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

pokemon.name: Cubchoo
pokemon.description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

pokemon.name: Beartic
pokemon.description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

pokemon.name: Cryogonal
pokemon.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Shelmet
pokemon.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

pokemon.name: Accelgor
pokemon.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

pokemon.name: Stunfisk
pokemon.description: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

pokemon.name: Mienfoo
pokemon.description: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.

pokemon.name: Mienshao
pokemon.description: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you're in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!

pokemon.name: Druddigon
pokemon.description: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.

pokemon.name: Golett
pokemon.description: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.

pokemon.name: Golurk
pokemon.description: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.

pokemon.name: Pawniard
pokemon.description: It follows Bisharp's orders to a tee when it attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent, Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.

pokemon.name: Bisharp
pokemon.description: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn't even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.

pokemon.name: Bouffalant
pokemon.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

pokemon.name: Rufflet
pokemon.description: Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in order to gain their acceptance.

pokemon.name: Braviary
pokemon.description: Known as “the hero of the skies," this Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will never retreat, even when it's injured.

pokemon.name: Vullaby
pokemon.description: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

pokemon.name: Mandibuzz
pokemon.description: It's always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.

pokemon.name: Heatmor
pokemon.description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

pokemon.name: Durant
pokemon.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

pokemon.name: Deino
pokemon.description: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

pokemon.name: Zweilous
pokemon.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

pokemon.name: Hydreigon
pokemon.description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

pokemon.name: Larvesta
pokemon.description: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

pokemon.name: Volcarona
pokemon.description: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

pokemon.name: Cobalion
pokemon.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Terrakion
pokemon.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Virizion
pokemon.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

pokemon.name: Tornadus
pokemon.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

pokemon.name: Thundurus
pokemon.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

pokemon.name: Reshiram
pokemon.description: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

pokemon.name: Zekrom
pokemon.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

pokemon.name: Landorus
pokemon.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

pokemon.name: Kyurem
pokemon.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemon.name: Keldeo
pokemon.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

pokemon.name: Meloetta
pokemon.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

pokemon.name: Genesect
pokemon.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

pokemon.name: Meltan
pokemon.description: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

pokemon.name: Melmetal
pokemon.description: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
